block.p: Lisa Jankowsky, a daughter of Carol and Joel Jankowsky of McLean, Va., was married last evening to Darius David Brawn, the son of Suzy and Edwin Brawn of McLean. Rabbi Joseph Levenson officiated at the Congressional Country Club in Bethesda, Md.
The couple graduated from Middlebury College.

Lisa Jankowsky, a daughter of Carol and Joel Jankowsky of McLean, Va., was married last evening to Darius David Brawn, the son of Suzy and Edwin Brawn of McLean. Rabbi Joseph Levenson officiated at the Congressional Country Club in Bethesda, Md.
The couple graduated from Middlebury College.

Mrs. Brawn, 25, received a Master of Education degree in counseling psychology from Teachers College at Columbia University. Until March, she was the admissions evaluator at the Browning School in New York, where she is to become the director of middle and upper school admissions in September. Her father is a senior partner and a lobbyist at the Washington law firm of Akin, Gump, Strauss, Hauer & Feld, directing its public law and policy section. He is also a director of the Cancer Research Foundation of America, where the bride's mother is a member of the board of associates.

Mr. Brawn, 27, is a research and analysis associate at the Endicott Group, a hedge fund in New York. His mother is a State Department manager in Washington who has also served in Germany, Sri Lanka and Cyprus. His father retired as the deputy assistant secretary for policy planning and development at the State Department; he was a Foreign Service officer in Germany, Israel and Egypt.
